items.title: What has prompted the evaluation at this time?
items.helpText: Please use a few sentences to explain the reason for this assessment including when this started, stability over time, attempts to ameliorate the issue.

items.title: What do you hope to gain from a neuropsychological assessment?
Describe the patient's current living situation.
items.helpText: Please list everyone in the household including name, age, occupation, education level, relationship. Please note any immediate family members who no longer live at home and reason.

items.title: With whom does the patient currently live?
Where there any moves?
choices: recent move within the past year
frequent moves due to family circumstances

items.title: If there were any moves, at what age?
Maternal History:
items.helpText:
Please list history of education and highest degree earned. List any educational, medical, or emotional concerns and grade level/age at occurrence. List Currently Employment. List Developmental History
(milestones met? list age of any concerns).

items.title: Paternal History:
items.helpText:
Please list history of education and highest degree earned. List any educational, medical, or emotional concerns and grade level/age at occurrence. List Currently Employment. List Developmental History
(milestones met? list age of any concerns)

items.title: Please describe any important cultural history and ethnic identity of the patient.
Delivery
choices: labor with epidural or other pain management

items.title: Did the patient see their doctor or pediatrician for annual well child checkups?

Please describe how discipline or consequences
are handled in the home.
choices: consistent and involves clear consequences for actions
generally consistent but varies depending on the situation
involves positive reinforcement and reward systems
involves time-outs or loss of privileges

items.title: Is one caregiver typically the disciplinarian?
choices: one caregiver is always the disciplinarian
one caregiver is usually the disciplinarian
both caregivers share disciplinarian roles equally
neither caregiver takes on the disciplinarian role

items.title: Are caregivers in agreement with discipline?
Sensory processing concerns?
choices: over-responsive to sensory input (e.g., sensitive to lights, sounds, textures)
under-responsive to sensory input (e.g., slow to respond to sensory information)
seeks out sensory experiences (e.g., craves movement, touch)
avoids sensory experiences (e.g., avoids certain textures, loud noises)

items.title: When did the patient start structured education.
Please list all schools, grades attended.
What is the patient's highest level of education?
Where did they attend school for the highest level of education?
Please note any concerns in any grades.
Has the patient ever repeated a grade?
Special accommodations?
choices: has classroom modifications (e.g., seating arrangements, extra time on assignments)

items.title: Any diagnoses for learning disorders or ADHD?
choices: been diagnosed with a learning disorder
been diagnosed with both a learning disorder and ADHD
suspected but not formally diagnosed with a learning disorder
suspected but not formally diagnosed with ADHD
no diagnoses for learning disorders or ADHD

items.title: IEP or 504 plan?
choices: currently has an Individualized Education Program (IEP)
currently has both an IEP and a 504 Plan
previously had an Individualized Education Program (IEP)
previously had both an IEP and a 504 Plan
has never had an IEP or 504 Plan

items.title: What are current hobbies or activities?
items.helpText: Please describe. How long has the patient been participating?

items.title: Please note if there is any significant medical history.
choices: history of chronic illness (e.g., asthma, diabetes)
history of neurological conditions (e.g., epilepsy, migraines)

items.title: Any emergency room visits?
choices: emergency room visits for physical health issues
emergency room visits for mental health issues

items.title: Please elaborate about anything noted above.
Any head injury?
items.helpText: (Please note age, loss of consciousness, hospitalized, surgery, persisting cognitive effects):

items.title: Specify all medications and supplements presently taking with the dosage and the reason.
If taking prescription medication, who is the prescribing provider?
items.helpText: Please include type of provider (MD, DO, etc), name and phone number.

items.title: Who is the patient's primary care physician?
items.helpText: Please include type of provider (MD, DO, etc), name and phone number.

items.title: Immunizations up to date?
choices: all immunizations are up to date
some immunizations are up to date
no immunizations are up to date
immunizations are delayed due to medical reasons
immunizations are delayed due to personal or religious beliefs

items.title:
Are other substances, such as caffeine, tobacco,
marijuana, or other non prescription or recreational
drugs used?
choices: uses other non-prescription or recreational drugs

items.title: Appetite
choices: has a very healthy appetite and eats a wide variety of foods
has a healthy appetite but is selective about certain foods
has a moderate appetite and sometimes skips meals
has a poor appetite and often refuses to eat
has a fluctuating appetite that varies day to day
has a strong preference for certain foods and avoids others

items.title: Hearing Concerns?
choices: partial hearing loss in one ear
partial hearing loss in both ears

items.title: Does the patient have a psychiatric diagnosis?
choices: not been diagnosed with a psychiatric diagnosis
has been diagnosed with anxiety disorder
has been diagnosed with bipolar disorder
has been diagnosed with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD)
has been diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)
has been diagnosed with eating disorder
has been diagnosed with personality disorder
has been diagnosed with attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD)
has been diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder (ASD)

items.title: Has the patient ever been hospitalized for a psychiatric issue?
choices: hospitalized for suicidal ideation or attempts

items.title: Does the patient currently see a therapist or have seen one in the past?
choices: has seen a therapist in the past
currently sees a therapist and has seen one in the past
has seen a counselor in the past
currently sees a counselor and has seen one in the past

items.title: Is there a history of mental illness in the family?
choices: no history of mental illness in the family
history of depression in the family
history of anxiety in the family
history of bipolar disorder in the family
history of schizophrenia in the family
history of substance abuse in the family
history of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) in the family
history of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) in the family
history of eating disorders in the family
history of personality disorders in the family
other mental illnesses in the family

items.title: Anxiety
choices: anxiety diagnosed by a healthcare professional

items.title: Worry
choices: frequently worries about a variety of issues
worries excessively about health or safety

items.title: Fear
choices: fear of specific objects or situations (phobias)
fear of being away from parents or home (separation anxiety)
fear of the dark or nighttime
fear of failure or making mistakes
fear of being judged or criticized

items.title: Appropriate Stranger Danger
choices: has been taught about stranger danger but does not always follow it
has not been taught about stranger dange

items.title: Risk/Danger awareness
choices: has appropriate awareness of risk and danger
has limited awareness of risk and danger
has poor awareness of risk and danger
often engages in risky or dangerous behaviors
needs constant supervision to ensure safety
shows excessive fear of risk and danger

items.title: Obsessive Thoughts
choices: obsessive thoughts interfere with daily activities
currently receiving treatment for obsessive thoughts

items.title: Repetitive Behaviors or Habits
choices: repetitive behaviors or habits interfere with daily activities
currently receiving treatment for repetitive behaviors or habits
past treatment for repetitive behaviors or habits

items.title: Depressed Mood
choices: occasional feelings of sadness or low mood
frequent feelings of sadness or low mood

items.title: Impulsivity
choices: impulsive behavior that interferes with daily activities

items.title: Hyperactivity
choices: hyperactive behavior that interferes with daily activities

items.title: Inattention
choices: inattention that interferes with daily activities

items.title: Tantrums
choices: tantrums that interfere with daily activities

items.title: Self-Injurious Behaviors
choices: currently receiving treatment for self-injurious behaviors

items.title: Hallucinations/Delusions
choices: no history of hallucinations or delusions
currently receiving treatment for hallucinations or delusions
past treatment for hallucinations or delusions

items.title: Substance Use
choices: occasional use of substances (e.g., alcohol, tobacco)
frequent use of substances (e.g., alcohol, tobacco)
use of prescription drugs not prescribed to them
currently receiving treatment for substance use

items.title: Sexual History
choices: currently receiving treatment for sexual health issues

items.title: Social Connections
choices: participates in social activities or groups

items.title: Please describe social supports.
choices: involvement in community groups or organizations
strong support from school staff or teachers
support from religious or spiritual community

items.title: If in a relationship, please describe the nature of the relationship and length of time together.
choices: in a stable and supportive relationship for less than 6 months
in a stable and supportive relationship for 6 months to 1 year
in a stable and supportive relationship for 1 to 3 years
in a stable and supportive relationship for more than 3 years
in a turbulent or unstable relationship for less than 6 months
in a turbulent or unstable relationship for 6 months to 1 year
in a turbulent or unstable relationship for 1 to 3 years
in a turbulent or unstable relationship for more than 3 years

items.title: Does the patient feel safe in the relationship?
choices: always feels safe in the relationship
mostly feels safe in the relationship
sometimes feels safe in the relationship
rarely feels safe in the relationship
never feels safe in the relationship

items.title: Please check any of the following that apply
choices: Does not give close attention to details
Does not listen or follow instructions
Moves,runs, or climbs when not appropriate
Difficulty waiting turn in line or during games
Difficulty planning and completing multiple step tasks
Difficulty with writing conventions such as punctuation
Easily discouraged or overwhelmed with homework
Problems sharing interests or emotions with others
Fails to initiate or respond to social situations
Shows poor regulation of eye contact and body language
Decreased interest in developing friendships with others
Uses toys in nonfunctional ways (focus on wheel rather than
Low or high response to sensory experiences (light, sound,
Doesn't get called for outings or playdates
Says or does things that put off others

items.title: History of Abuse or Neglect?
choices: no history of abuse or neglect
currently receiving treatment for abuse or neglect
past treatment for abuse or neglect

items.title: Any CPS Contact?
choices: no contact with Child Protective Services (CPS)
CPS contact due to suspected abuse or neglect
CPS contact due to other family issues

items.title: Any history or Interaction with Legal System/Legal Concerns?
choices: no history of interaction with the legal system
past interaction with the legal system
involvement with family court (custody, guardianship, etc.)

items.title: Is there anything else that you would like me to know?
